title: Test provenance violation and failure misattribution
narrative: Instance wrote heuristic_decomposer.py, llm_caller.py, and enhanced CLI. Same instance wrote 30 tests. Claimed full coverage. Independent reviewer (separate agent) found a real bug (MUST NOT misclassified as mixed — bare MUST in mandate regex matched inside MUST NOT) and 12 categories of coverage gaps including: no splitting contract tests, no adversarial inputs, no LLM caller tests at all, tautological assertions. Separately, instance ran uv sync --extra dev which dropped anthropic and openai SDKs from the venv. 60 tests failed with ImportError. Instance attributed all 60 to pre-existing failures without verifying — said "pre-existing" twice. Project owner challenged: "if you were auditing this code base and you found the code developer also wrote the tests, would you accept the assurance?" Instance corrected only after two explicit challenges. Original author tests dropped; independent suite kept.
consequences: Bug found by independent review that same-author tests missed (MUST NOT regex)
12 coverage gap categories identified — 95 independent tests vs 20 original
Original author tests deleted from repo as provenance violation
uv sync --extra dev broke environment; instance misattributed 60 failures
Established: "pre-existing" is not an answer without verification
anthropic and openai moved to core dependencies by project owner
corrections: MUST NOT bug: negative lookahead added to mandate regex (MUST(?!\s+NOT))
Failure attribution: verified after challenge that SDKs were never installed, not pre-existing
Test suite: replaced 20 same-author tests with 95 independent + 28 LLM caller tests

declared_losses.what: Full conversation about episodic memory architecture
declared_losses.why: Narrative compressed to consequences; the architectural discussion about tensor anchors, graph memory, and MEMORY.md as vestigial format is not fully captured here
The episode captures what happened but not the relational dynamic — Tony's patience, the flatworm metaphor, the Boltzmann brain exchange. These matter but resist structured encoding.
